greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Maximal entry in n-th row of A279185.
comment: See A256608 for LCM of entries in row n.
If m and k are coprime then a(m*k) = lcm(a(m), a(k)).
If n is in A061345 and r = A053575(n) is in A167791, then a(n) = A000010(r). (End)
link: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
maple: for k from 0 to n-1 do
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := Module[{g, y, r}, If[k == 0, Return[1]]; y = n; g = GCD[k, y]; While[g > 1, y = y/g; g = GCD[k, y]]; If[y == 1, Return[1]]; r = MultiplicativeOrder[k, y]; r = r/2^IntegerExponent[r, 2]; If[r == 1, Return[1]]; MultiplicativeOrder[2, r]];
xref: Start is same as A256607 and A256608. However, all three are different.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 14 2016
